metadata.title: Project at the Edge
metadata.subtitle: Lite
metadata.description: You're a project lead facing a crisis. Your client demands an update today, but your team is 17 days behind schedule. Navigate workplace pressure and discover how your mind handles risk, clarity, courage, and empathy.
metadata.hint: Tests your Risk mindset, Clarity & structure, Courage / ownership, and Empathy / people focus

dimensions.label: Risk mindset
dimensions.description: How you approach uncertainty and bold decisions

dimensions.label: Clarity & structure
dimensions.description: How you prioritize understanding and organization

dimensions.label: Courage / ownership
dimensions.description: How you take responsibility under pressure

dimensions.label: Empathy / people focus
dimensions.description: How you consider others in your decisions

scenes.label: Scene 1
scenes.title: The email at 7:28 AM
scenes.body: You arrive at work. Coffee in one hand, laptop in the other. A red notification pops up: "URGENT — NEED UPDATE TODAY" from your CEO. You know the project is not fully on track.
scenes.tip: Your first move reveals how you meet pressure.

options.label: A
options.main: Open the email immediately.
options.desc: Face the message head-on before anything else.

options.label: B
options.main: Get coffee and take a breath first.
options.desc: Stabilise yourself to avoid reacting from panic.

options.label: C
options.main: Check the project board before opening.
options.desc: Collect facts first so you're not blind.

options.label: D
options.main: Message a teammate: "Did something happen?"
options.desc: Seek social confirmation before facing it.

scenes.label: Scene 2
scenes.title: What do you tell the CEO?
scenes.body:
You open the email. The message is sharp: "Client is asking for an update today. Where are we?"

The truth: you're behind schedule by 17 days.
scenes.tip: Your words now reveal how you handle responsibility.

options.label: A
options.main: Tell the CEO the truth and promise a plan in 1 hour.

options.label: B
options.main: Ask the team: "Can we catch up in two days?"

options.label: C
options.main: Try to fix the blockers yourself quietly.
options.desc: You take everything on your shoulders.

options.label: D
options.main: Soften the truth: "We had challenges but working on it."
options.desc: You avoid confrontation and soften impact.

scenes.label: Scene 3
scenes.title: The morning huddle
scenes.body: Your team gathers. Everyone looks tense. A developer finally says: "Requirements changed too often. We're confused."

options.label: A
options.main: Clarify the requirements again.
options.desc: You take charge and provide structure.

options.label: B
options.main: Ask each member what's blocking them.

options.label: C
options.main: Refocus: "Let's deliver what we can today."
options.desc: You shift from talk to action.

options.label: D
options.main: Stay silent and observe first.

scenes.label: Scene 4
scenes.title: The client call
scenes.body:
It's time for the client call. They look tense:
"Are we on track? This delay affects our launch."
scenes.tip: Your response shows courage and strategic clarity.

options.label: A
options.main: "We're behind — here's why, and here's the recovery plan."

options.label: B
options.main: "We had issues, but we're stabilising."

options.label: C
options.main: "We can meet launch if we cut some features."

options.label: D
options.main: "What is most critical for your launch?"

scenes.label: Scene 5
scenes.title: The CEO follows up
scenes.body:
Your CEO messages immediately:
"Did you tell them the full truth?"
scenes.tip: Here you show alignment or avoidance.

options.label: A
options.main: "Yes. The full truth and a recovery plan."

options.label: B
options.main: "I softened it a little."

options.label: C
options.main: "I proposed cutting features to meet deadline."

options.label: D
options.main: "I asked for their top priority first."

scenes.label: Scene 6
scenes.title: Shadow You Appears
scenes.body:
A glitch flashes on your screen. A character appears:
Shadow You — a version of you who chooses the opposite mindset.

They ask: "Why do you always choose the same patterns?"
scenes.tip: Your response shows openness or defensiveness.

options.label: A
options.main: "Your approach feels risky."

options.label: B
options.main: "Interesting… tell me more."

options.label: C
options.main: "I want to understand how you think."

options.label: D
options.main: "No thanks. I trust my way."

scenes.label: Scene 7
scenes.title: Choose your final door
scenes.body:
Three glowing doors appear in a long corridor. Each represents a mindset path:

Door 1 — The Safe Path
Door 2 — The Smart Path
Door 3 — The Brave Path
scenes.tip: This final choice reveals how you face the future.

options.label: A
options.main: Enter the Safe Path.

options.label: B
options.main: Enter the Smart Path.

options.label: C
options.main: Enter the Brave Path.

growthSuggestions.text: Consider taking more ownership. Your analytical strength can be paired with bolder action.
While you take decisive action, consider how decisions impact your team. Empathy strengthens leadership.
Your bold approach works best when paired with clarity. Take time to gather information before acting.
You have strong stability. Challenge yourself to take calculated risks—growth often lives at the edge of comfort.
You show balance across dimensions. Continue integrating your strengths and watch for patterns in how you lead.
